sense.def: Pathological Condition of a dian xian 癲癇 , peak-illness with epilepsy, which, at the time of its outbreaks, makes the patient’s four limbs twitch and his eyes be fixed to look straight ahead, together with abdominal distension, to make him resemble a buffalo. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 5: 牛癇之為病，目正直視，腹脹 , “The disease of buffalo epilepsy : the eyes stare straight ahead, and the abdomen is distended”. Nong chuang 膿瘡 , festering sores [4]
Alternative Names chuang nong 瘡膿.

Pathological Condition Combined Designation of open chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions with pus emitted as a major sign. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 1: 民病熱中、聾瞑、血溢、膿瘡 , “The people suffer from heated center, deafness and blindness, blood overflow, and festering sores ”.
